intro: Setaria longissima, commonly known as slender dropseed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in prairies and open woodlands. Setaria longissima is drought-tolerant and serves as a valuable component of native plant communities.
